learning_objective: Enable learner to give a 3-minute presentation on sustainable living in cities

days.title: The Green Apartment
days.story:
Maya moved into her new apartment last week. Her neighbor, Tom, knocked on her door.

"Hi! I'm Tom from next door. Welcome to the building!"

"Thanks! I'm Maya. Nice to meet you."

"I noticed you have lots of boxes. Moving is hard work!" Tom smiled.

"Yes, and my energy bills are already high!" Maya sighed.

"I can help you **save energy bills**," Tom offered. "Our building has a green living program."

"Green living? What's that?" Maya asked.

"It means we try to **reduce our impact** on the planet. We **make small changes** in our daily life."

"That sounds interesting. But is it difficult?"

"Not at all! Small things are **better for environment** and save money too."

Maya invited Tom inside. He looked around her apartment.

"First, let's check your light bulbs," Tom suggested. "LED bulbs **save energy bills** every month."

"I didn't know that! What else can I do?"

"You can **reduce our impact** by using less water. Short showers help a lot."

"I love long showers though!" Maya laughed.

"I did too! But when I saw how much I saved, I decided to **make small changes**. Now I take five-minute showers."

"Five minutes? That's fast!"

"You get used to it. And it's **better for environment** too. The planet needs our help."

Tom showed Maya the recycling bins in the basement. "We separate paper, plastic, and glass here."

"In my old building, everything went in one bin," Maya said.

"Recycling helps **reduce our impact** on landfills. It's one of the easiest changes."

"You're right. I want to **make small changes** too. Where do I start?"

"Start with one thing. Maybe change your bulbs first. Then add more green habits slowly."

"Thanks, Tom! I feel motivated now. Let's **save energy bills** together!"

"Welcome to our green community!" Tom smiled.
presentation_phrases: Let me introduce the topic of...
First, I'd like to talk about...

days.title: The Community Garden
days.story:
Saturday morning, Maya met Tom at the community garden behind their building.

"This is amazing!" Maya exclaimed. "I didn't know we had **urban green spaces** here!"

"We started it two years ago," Tom explained. "Now twenty families **grow your own** vegetables."

An elderly woman walked over with a basket. "Tom! Who's your friend?"

"Mrs. Chen, this is Maya. She just moved in."

"Welcome! Would you like some tomatoes? They're **fresh local produce** from my plot."

"They smell wonderful!" Maya said. "I've never tried to **grow your own** food before."

"It's easier than you think," Mrs. Chen smiled. "And gardens **bring people together** too."

Tom showed Maya around. "Each family has a small plot. We share tools and knowledge."

"Look at all these vegetables! This really helps create **urban green spaces** in the city."

"Exactly! And when you **grow your own** food, you know it's organic and fresh."

A young boy ran up to them. "Mom says lunch is ready! We're having salad from our garden!"

"That's my son, Leo," Tom said. "He loves our **fresh local produce**."

"Do vegetables really taste different?" Maya asked.

"Oh yes! Supermarket tomatoes travel thousands of miles. Our **fresh local produce** is picked today!"

Mrs. Chen nodded. "And gardens do more than feed us. They **bring people together** every weekend."

"I see people talking and laughing," Maya observed. "It's like a little village."

"That's the magic of **urban green spaces**," Tom agreed. "We know our neighbors now."

"Can I have a plot too?" Maya asked excitedly.

"Of course! We have one empty space. You can start to **grow your own** herbs first."

"Herbs are perfect for beginners," Mrs. Chen added. "And nothing beats **fresh local produce** in your cooking!"

"This garden really does **bring people together**," Maya smiled. "Count me in!"

"Welcome to our garden family!" everyone cheered.
presentation_phrases: This brings me to my next point...
Let me give you an example...

days.title: The Zero Waste Shop
days.story:
Maya and Tom walked to a special shop on Green Street.

"I've never seen a shop like this!" Maya said, looking through the window.

"It's a zero-waste store. We can **reduce plastic waste** by shopping here," Tom explained.

"But how do you buy things without packages?"

"You'll see! Did you **bring reusable bags** and containers?"

"Yes, I have them here." Maya held up her cloth bags.

Inside, the shop owner, David, greeted them warmly. "Tom! And a new customer?"

"David, meet Maya. She wants to learn about **package-free shopping**."

"Perfect! Let me show you around. This helps people make **sustainable lifestyle choices** easily."

Maya saw large bins filled with rice, pasta, and nuts. "So I just take what I need?"

"Exactly! You **bring reusable bags**, fill them up, and pay by weight," David demonstrated.

"This really helps **reduce plastic waste**," Maya realized. "No plastic bags at all!"

"That's the idea. **Package-free shopping** is better for our planet," David said.

Tom showed Maya the cleaning products section. "You can refill shampoo bottles here too."

"Really? I usually throw away so many plastic bottles!"

"Not anymore! These **sustainable lifestyle choices** save money and the environment."

A customer entered with glass jars. "Hi David! I need to refill my olive oil."

"See? Everyone here makes effort to **reduce plastic waste**," David pointed out.

Maya started filling a bag with oats. "This feels good. I'm actually helping the planet!"

"Every time you **bring reusable bags**, you prevent more plastic pollution," Tom agreed.

"How long have you been doing **package-free shopping**?" Maya asked Tom.

"About a year now. It's become one of my favorite **sustainable lifestyle choices**."

"The best part?" David added. "You buy only what you need. Less food waste too!"

"I'm convinced!" Maya laughed. "From now on, I'll always **bring reusable bags** here."

"Another person choosing to **reduce plastic waste**!" David smiled. "Welcome to our community!"

days.title: The Bike-Sharing Revolution
days.story:
Monday morning, Maya was rushing to catch the bus when Tom called out.

"Maya! Why don't you try the city bikes?"

"City bikes? I haven't ridden in years!"

"They're one of the best **public transport options** now. Come, I'll show you!"

At the bike station, Tom explained the system. "These bikes are **smart city solutions** for traffic problems."

"How does it work?" Maya asked, examining the bright blue bikes.

"Use this app. Find a bike, unlock it, ride anywhere, and dock it when done."

"But is it safe? The traffic looks scary."

"The city built special bike lanes. It helps **reduce carbon footprint** and promotes **healthy lifestyle habits**."

A woman docked her bike nearby. "Morning, Tom! Beautiful day for cycling!"

"Hi Sarah! This is Maya. I'm showing her our **public transport options**."

"Oh, you'll love it!" Sarah said. "I started cycling last month. It's changed my life!"

"Really? How?" Maya was curious.

"I feel healthier, save money, and **reduce carbon footprint** every day. Win-win-win!"

Tom helped Maya adjust a bike. "Ready to try? We'll go slowly."

"Okay... here goes!" Maya pushed off nervously.

After a few wobbly moments, Maya found her balance. "This is fun!"

"See? Cycling creates **healthy lifestyle habits** naturally," Tom said, riding beside her.

"And look - no traffic jams!" Maya noticed. "We're moving faster than cars!"

"That's why cities invest in **smart city solutions** like this," Tom explained.

They stopped at a café. Other bikes were parked outside.

"Many people combine **public transport options**," Tom said. "Bike to the train, then bike to work."

"I never thought about that. It would **reduce carbon footprint** even more."

"Exactly! And cycling is one of the best **healthy lifestyle habits** you can develop."

"I'm sold!" Maya laughed. "These **smart city solutions** really work!"

"Welcome to the bike revolution!" Tom grinned.

days.title: The Repair Café
days.story:
Saturday afternoon, Tom invited Maya to a special event at the community center.

"What's a Repair Café?" Maya asked, seeing the colorful sign.

"It's where we **fix instead of buying** new things. Volunteers help repair anything!"

Inside, tables were busy with activity. People fixed toasters, sewed clothes, and repaired bikes.

"This is amazing!" Maya exclaimed. "Everyone seems to **share skills and knowledge** freely."

An older man waved them over. "Tom! Good to see you!"

"Hi Robert! This is Maya. Robert fixes electronics here."

"Bring anything broken?" Robert asked Maya.

"Actually, yes! My favorite lamp stopped working." Maya pulled it from her bag.

"Let's see... Ah, loose wire! We can **fix instead of buying** a new one easily."

"Really? The store said to buy a new lamp."

"Stores always say that!" Robert laughed. "But we can **extend product life** with simple repairs."

While Robert worked, Tom explained more. "This follows **circular economy principles** - use things longer."

"I usually just throw broken things away," Maya admitted.

"Most people do. But when we **share skills and knowledge**, we reduce waste dramatically."

A young woman approached with a torn jacket. "Can anyone help with this?"

"I can!" Another volunteer said. "Let's **extend product life** with some creative mending."

Maya watched, fascinated. "People really **fix instead of buying** everything here?"

"Everything possible," Tom confirmed. "It builds community and saves resources."

"Fixed!" Robert announced, plugging in Maya's lamp. It glowed warmly.

"That took five minutes! And saved me fifty dollars!"

"That's the power of **circular economy principles**," Robert smiled. "Repair, reuse, recycle."

"Can I volunteer here too?" Maya asked. "I want to **share skills and knowledge** with others."

"Of course! What can you fix?"

"I'm good at sewing. My grandmother taught me."

"Perfect! We need more people who can **extend product life** through mending."

"This is so inspiring," Maya said. "From now on, I'll always try to **fix instead of buying** new!"

days.title: The Energy Workshop
days.story:
Tom and Maya attended an energy workshop at their building's community room.

"Welcome everyone!" The speaker, Dr. Patel, began. "Today we'll learn to **monitor energy usage** at home."

"I never really check my energy use," Maya whispered to Tom.

"That's why we're here! Knowledge helps us **switch to renewable** options wisely."

Dr. Patel showed a graph. "Most people don't realize how much energy they waste daily."

"How can we change that?" someone asked.

"First, **monitor energy usage** with smart meters. Know where energy goes."

Maya raised her hand. "Is it expensive to **invest in efficiency** improvements?"

"Great question! Small changes are free. Bigger ones pay for themselves over time."

Tom added, "I saved 30% after I decided to **switch to renewable** energy supplier."

"Exactly!" Dr. Patel nodded. "Individual choices create our **sustainable energy future** together."

A resident asked, "What about solar panels? Are they worth it?"

"Solar is excellent when you **invest in efficiency** first. Reduce demand, then generate clean power."

Dr. Patel demonstrated a monitoring app. "This helps you **monitor energy usage** in real-time."

"Look!" Maya showed Tom her phone. "My air conditioner uses so much!"

"That's why awareness matters. Now you can make informed choices."

"Our building plans to **switch to renewable** sources next year," the building manager announced.

"That's wonderful! Community action accelerates our **sustainable energy future**," Dr. Patel said.

During the break, residents discussed their plans.

"I'll start to **monitor energy usage** daily," one neighbor decided.

"I want to **invest in efficiency** - maybe new windows?" another suggested.

Maya felt inspired. "This workshop opened my eyes. Small steps lead to big changes!"

"When we all **switch to renewable** thinking, we protect our planet," Tom agreed.

"Thank you all for caring about our **sustainable energy future**!" Dr. Patel concluded.

Everyone left with new knowledge and determination to change.

days.title: Presenting Green Solutions
days.story:
The community center was full. Maya stood nervously at the front, ready to present.

"You'll do great!" Tom whispered. "Just share what you've learned."

Maya took a deep breath. "Good evening, everyone. Today I'll talk about how we can **implement sustainable practices** in our daily lives."

The audience listened attentively as Maya began.

"Two weeks ago, I knew nothing about green living. Now I see how we can **create positive impact** together."

She showed photos from her journey. "This is our community garden. Growing food helps **build green communities** and brings neighbors together."

Mrs. Chen smiled proudly from the audience.

"Zero-waste shopping might seem hard, but it's actually fun! When we **implement sustainable practices** like bringing reusable bags, we reduce plastic dramatically."

David from the shop nodded approvingly.

"City bikes aren't just transport - they **inspire behavior change** and improve our health too."

Sarah gave Maya a thumbs up.

"The Repair Café taught me we can **create positive impact** by fixing things instead of throwing them away."

Robert clapped enthusiastically.

"And energy awareness helps us **build green communities** that protect our planet's future."

Dr. Patel smiled from the back row.

"But here's the most important thing I learned," Maya continued. "Change doesn't happen alone. We **inspire behavior change** by working together."

She looked at her new friends. "Each person here helped me **implement sustainable practices** in different ways."

"When communities unite, we **create positive impact** that spreads beyond our building."

The audience was engaged, asking questions.

"How do we start?" someone asked.

"Pick one thing. Just one. Maybe visit the zero-waste shop. Or try the city bikes. Small steps **inspire behavior change** in ourselves and others."

"Together, we can **build green communities** that make our city better for everyone."

The room erupted in applause. Maya beamed with pride.

"That was perfect!" Tom congratulated her. "You really did **create positive impact** today!"

"Thanks to all of you," Maya replied. "This community taught me everything!"
presentation_phrases: In conclusion, I'd like to emphasize...
Thank you for your attention. I'm happy to answer questions.
